sense.name: economic term: raise economic demand, expand the money supply, or raise prices to experience reflation
sense.examples: This would free up the capital to reflate the economies of the periphery. This continuously pressured the administration to reflate the economy. The United States saw no reason to reflate its money supply. It would take a trillion or more to relate the economy. The fiscal stimulus is being worked out to reflate the economy,

sense.name: inflate against
sense.examples: They had to reflate the balloon.
